content.introduction:
The check converts the usage of null pointer constants (e.g. 
NULL
, 
0
)
to use the new C++11 and C23 
nullptr
 keyword.

Example
Â¶


void
 
assignment
()
 
{


  
char
 
*
a
 
=
 
NULL
;


  
char
 
*
b
 
=
 
0
;


  
char
 
c
 
=
 
0
;


}



int
 
*
ret_ptr
()
 
{


  
return
 
0
;


}






transforms to:


void
 
assignment
()
 
{


  
char
 
*
a
 
=
 
nullptr
;


  
char
 
*
b
 
=
 
nullptr
;


  
char
 
c
 
=
 
0
;


}



int
 
*
ret_ptr
()
 
{


  
return
 
nullptr
;


}

Options
Â¶






IgnoredTypes
Â¶


Semicolon-separated list of regular expressions to match pointer types for
which implicit casts will be ignored. Default value:

std::_CmpUnspecifiedParam::;^std::__cmp_cat::__unspec
.








NullMacros
Â¶


Comma-separated list of macro names that will be transformed along with

NULL
. By default this check will only replace the 
NULL
 macro and will
skip any similar user-defined macros.






Example
Â¶


#define MY_NULL (void*)0


void
 
assignment
()
 
{


  
void
 
*
p
 
=
 
MY_NULL
;


}






transforms to:


#define MY_NULL NULL


void
 
assignment
()
 
{


  
int
 
*
p
 
=
 
nullptr
;


}






if the 
NullMacros
 option is set to 
MY_NULL
.
